title: 112_s1749
content: The Act is titled the "Center to Advance, Monitor, and Preserve University Security Safety Act of 2011" or the "CAMPUS Safety Act of 2011". It amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to establish a National Center for Campus Public Safety. The Act establishes the National Center for Campus Public Safety, granting authority to award grants for education, training, and research to enhance campus safety. The National Center for Campus Public Safety aims to foster quality research, serve as a clearinghouse for relevant information, and develop protocols to prevent, protect against, respond to, and recover from emergencies. The National Center for Campus Public Safety aims to prevent campus violence, coordinate safety information and resources, and enhance cooperation among law enforcement and mental health agencies serving higher education institutions. The Center will develop standardized formats for mutual aid agreements, report annually to Congress, and coordinate with available resources within the Department of Homeland Security. The term 'institution of higher education' is defined in section 101 of the Higher Education Act of 1965. $2,750,000 is authorized to be appropriated for each fiscal year from 2012 through 2016. SEC. 3. JUSTICE PROGRAM CONSOLIDATION. Effective 30 days after enactment, the Office of Dispute Resolution of the Department of Justice will be transferred to the Office of Legal Policy and funded through its general administration appropriation. The Attorney General must implement policies to save $1,000,000 by consolidating programs from 2012 to 2016.
